result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexandria R Kowalski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Pay $300 fine plus costs
*Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office

Reminder Notice
Count 1:  Non-Probation (AMENDED TO A MISDEMEANOR)

Defendant Alexandria R Kowalski in court.  Attorney Anne Renc in court for Alexandria R Kowalski.  Attorney Robert J Jambois in court for State of Wisconsin. 

10:31 AM Court calls case.
Atty Jambois states appearances.

This is set for a plea and sentencing.

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. Defendant will be pleading to an amended charge.
State will file an amended information.
Atty Renc is ok with proceeding without an amended information.
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Amended Count : No Contest.

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty of Amended Charge. Misdemeanor Retail Theft.
Clerk directed to enter judgment of conviction this date.

Atty Jambois makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Atty Renc makes sentencing arguments to the court, this is a joint recommendation.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT: 
Amended Count: 
Pay a fine of $300 plus costs.
60 days to pay or set up a payment plan.
Submit DNA sample.
Pay DNA Surcharge.


State to file amended information to reflect the charge accurately.

BY THE COURT: On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.

Defendant wishes to have an attorney represent her.
Defendant was not eligible for a public defender.
